autumn.lang.internals

Class AbstractStaticFunctor

  • java.lang.Object
    • autumn.lang.internals.AbstractStaticFunctor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Functor, StaticFunctor, TypedFunctor
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FileProcessor, Predicate

    public abstract class AbstractStaticFunctor
extends java.lang.Object
implements StaticFunctor
    This class provides a partial implementation of the StaticFunctor interface.

      • apply

        public final void apply(ArgumentStack stack)
                 throws java.lang.Throwable
        This method performs an invocation of this function object.

        Programmers should not call this method directly. Instead, for convenience, call this method indirectly via (F::apply List).

        Calling Convention from top to bottom (n >= 0):

        1. argument[n]
        2. argument[.]
        3. argument[2]
        4. argument[1]
        5. argument[0]

        The argument stack will be cleared and then the result will be pushed onto it. If the functor does not return a value, then the stack will remain empty.

        Specified by:
        apply in interface Functor
        Specified by:
        apply in interface StaticFunctor
        Parameters:
        stack - is a stack containing the arguments being passed to this functor.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - in order to propagate exceptions thrown by the functor.
